intro: Heterostemma villosum var. menghaiense, commonly known as the Menghai hairy stem plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and white or pale pink in color. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
